item.title: 墨西哥总统称特朗普给贩毒集团贴上恐怖分子标签不会降低犯罪率
item.description: 墨西哥的克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）说，唐纳德-特朗普将贩毒集团列为外国恐怖组织的决定不会减少犯罪，她敦促美国新总统与墨西哥在安全和毒品预防方面开展合作。【原文：Mexico’s Claudia Sheinbaum said that Donald Trump’s decision to classify drug cartels as foreign terrorist organizations won’t reduce crime, urging the new US president to work with her nation on security and drug prevention instead.】

item.title: 凯文-穆尔谈市场对科技股的巨大集中押注
item.description:
"大 "还能继续 "大 "下去吗？【原文：

Can the big keep getting bigger?

】

item.title: Ascentage Pharma 1.26 亿美元首次公开募股后美国股价攀升
item.description: 中国生物制药公司 Ascentage Pharma Group International 的首次公开发行定价为 1.264 亿美元，较其亚洲股票折价，该公司股价在美国首次交易中上涨达 4%。【原文：Shares of Ascentage Pharma Group International rose as much as 4% in the Chinese biopharmaceutical company’s US trading debut after pricing its $126.4 million initial public offering at a discount to its Asian stock.】

item.title: 英国批准两座大型太阳能发电场，推动产能增长
item.description: 英国能源部长埃德-米利班德（Ed Miliband）批准了两个巨型太阳能项目，政府正努力推动投资并减少电力系统的二氧化碳排放量。【原文：UK Energy Minister Ed Miliband approved a pair of giant solar projects as the government seeks to drive investment and cut CO2 emissions from the power system.】

item.title: 显示 Venture Global 股票开盘价将比首次公开发行价高出约 6
item.description: 据悉，Venture Global 公司的股票开盘价将比首次公开发行价高出 6%，此前这家天然气出口商首次出售股票就筹集了 17.5 亿美元。【原文：Venture Global Inc. shares are indicated to open as much as 6% above their IPO price, after the natural gas exporter raised $1.75 billion in its first-time share sale.】

item.title: 苹果测试关键技术水准，遭遇 2008 年以来最差开局
item.description: 苹果公司的股价今年开局不佳，目前正徘徊在一个关键水平，如果被突破，可能预示着未来会有更大的下跌空间。【原文：Apple Inc.’s stock has had a rough start to the year and is now flirting with a key level that could signal more downside ahead if breached.】

item.title: 西格纳公司的本科在欺诈案调查中继续被拘留
item.description: 破产的 Signa 地产和零售集团的创始人雷内-本科（Rene Benko）将继续被审前拘留，检察官将继续调查其涉嫌欺诈的案件。【原文：Rene Benko, founder of the insolvent Signa property and retail conglomerate, will remain in pre-trial detention as prosecutors continue investigations into suspected fraud.】

item.title: 俄罗斯削减关税，转向进口以阻止土豆价格上涨
item.description: 俄罗斯正在采取措施抑制马铃薯价格的飙升，马铃薯是一种在全国家庭中无处不在的蔬菜，通货膨胀继续引发人们对弗拉基米尔-普京总统经济的担忧。【原文：Russia is taking steps to curb a spike in the price of potatoes, a vegetable ubiquitous in households throughout the country, as inflation continues to stoke worries for President Vladimir Putin’s economy.】

item.title: 美国现房销售在自 1995 年以来最糟糕的一年结束时回升
item.description: 12 月份，美国旧房销售连续第三个月增长，在经历了近 30 年来最糟糕的一年之后，进入 2025 年，旧房销售出现了一定的增长势头。【原文：Sales of previously owned homes in the US rose for the third straight month in December, entering 2025 with some momentum after the worst year in nearly three decades.】

item.title: 美国消费者信心指数六个月来首次下降
item.description: 由于担心失业问题和潜在关税对通胀的影响，1 月份美国消费者信心六个月来首次下降。【原文：US consumer sentiment declined in January for the first time in six months on concerns about unemployment and the impact of potential tariffs on inflation.】

item.title: 安大略省省长宣布举行紧急大选，准备与美国就贸易问题展开斗争
item.description: 安大略省省长呼吁提前举行大选，称其政府需要新的授权来反击美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）可能征收的关税。【原文：Ontario’s premier is calling an early election, saying his government needs a fresh mandate to push back against potential tariffs from US President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 服务业增长放缓，美国商业活动趋缓
item.description: 由于服务提供商的增长速度回落，美国商业活动的扩张速度为九个月来最慢。【原文：US business activity is expanding at the slowest pace in nine months on a pullback in the pace of growth at services providers.】

item.title: 据说西班牙电信吸引了对阿根廷业务的收购兴趣
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，已有投资者与西班牙电信公司（Telefonica SA）接洽，可能有意收购该公司在阿根廷的业务部门。【原文：Telefonica SA has been approached by investors potentially interested in buying its Argentina unit, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 据说帝亚吉欧将重新审视饮料组合以重启增长
item.description: 黛布拉-克鲁（Debra Crew）自就任帝亚吉欧集团首席执行官以来，经历了坎坷的一年半。【原文：Debra Crew has had a rocky year and a half since taking over as chief executive officer of Diageo Plc.】

item.title: 扎克伯格警告 2025 年 Meta 的资本支出将高于预期
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc.首席执行官马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）表示，他的公司将在 2025 年投资 600 亿至 650 亿美元用于人工智能相关的资本支出，远高于分析师预测的数字。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said his company will invest between $60 billion and $65 billion in capital expenditures related to artificial intelligence in 2025, well above the figure analysts had been projecting.】

item.title: 雪佛龙安哥拉公司在可能发生漏油事故后检查运营情况
item.description: 雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp. ）称，在安哥拉海岸出现油膜和碎片后，其卡宾达海湾石油公司（Cabinda Gulf Oil Co.【原文：Chevron Corp. said its Cabinda Gulf Oil Co. deployed a crude-spill response team after an oil sheen and debris were reported along the coast of Angola.】

item.title: 要让英国重新增长，我们需要廉价、安全的能源
item.description:
经济学家西蒙-弗伦奇（Simon French）做客《Merryn Talks Money》栏目，讨论为什么促进英国经济增长应从鼓励北海油气生产开始。【原文：

Economist Simon French joins Merryn Talks Money to discuss why boosting the UK's growth should start with encouraging North Sea oil and gas production.

】

item.title: 人工智能需求激增，NextEra 采取措施重启核电站
item.description: NextEra Energy Inc. 已要求美国监管机构对其已关闭的杜安阿诺德核电厂的许可证进行变更，这是在人工智能和数据中心用电量激增的情况下可能重启爱荷华州核电厂的第一步。【原文：NextEra Energy Inc. has asked US regulators for a licensing change for its shuttered Duane Arnold nuclear plant, a first step toward potentially restarting the Iowa facility amid soaring power consumption from artificial intelligence and data centers.】

item.title: 全球外汇交易准则》修订版发布，重点关注透明度
item.description: 一个负责监督每天 7.5 万亿美元外汇市场最佳实践自愿守则的委员会修订了指导方针，以提高这个监管松散行业的透明度。【原文：A committee overseeing the voluntary code of best practices for the $7.5 trillion-a-day foreign-exchange market revised guidelines to boost transparency in the loosely-regulated industry.】

item.title: 日本央行明确加息指引安抚市场，但可能适得其反
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫将利率上调至 2008 年以来的最高水平，通过谨慎地向投资者表明其计划，避免了市场动荡。但这一策略也有风险。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda raised interest rates to the highest level since 2008, avoiding market turmoil by carefully signaling his plans to investors. But that strategy carries its own risks.】

item.title: Vanguard 的 S&P 500 基金即将成为全球最大的 ETF
item.description: 看似势不可挡的资金洪流让 Vanguard Group Inc.【原文：A seemingly unstoppable flood of money has Vanguard Group Inc. on the brink of claiming a crown that State Street Corp. has held for decades.】

item.title: 乔普拉留任美国联邦储蓄委员会，特朗普团队就银行监管机构人选展开辩论
item.description: 随着两位拜登时代任命的银行监管机构领导人本周继续出现在工作岗位上，一些唐纳德-特朗普的支持者质疑总统为什么没有提出领导这些机构的提名人选，或者至少解雇现任负责人。【原文：As two Biden-era appointees leading bank watchdogs continue to show up to work this week, some Donald Trump supporters are questioning why the president hasn’t put forward nominees to lead the agencies, or at a minimum fire the current heads.】

item.title: 荷兰国际集团（ING）预计东欧债务将因持续的预算困境而大量抛售
item.description: 据荷兰国际集团（ING Groep NV）称，中欧和东欧最大的国家今年将再次需要大量借贷，一系列选举将加剧控制预算赤字的努力。【原文：The largest central and eastern European nations will again need to borrow heavily this year, with a series of elections adding to struggles to rein in budget deficits, according to ING Groep NV.】

item.title: 梅尔文资本创始合伙人克莱默筹备长期基金
item.description: 在加布-普洛特金（Gabe Plotkin）的公司因错误的空头押注而关闭两年多后，梅尔文资本管理公司（Melvin Capital Management）的一位创始合伙人正准备推出一只选股对冲基金。【原文：A founding partner of Melvin Capital Management is preparing to launch a stock-picking hedge fund more than two years after Gabe Plotkin’s firm shuttered under the weight of wrong-way short bets.】

item.title: 减税 ETF 开拓者准备再揽 50 亿美元大单
item.description: 在处理了对冲基金向 ETF 的首次转换四年后，韦斯-格雷（Wes Gray）正准备领导一股针对大小投资者的减税交易热潮。【原文：Four years after handling the first conversion of a hedge fund to an ETF, Wes Gray is gearing up to lead a surge of tax-busting deals aimed at investors big and small.】

item.title: 工党应对新年以来大量糟糕的经济数据
item.description: 在工党执政的第一个完整年度伊始，就出现了大量令企业和家庭感到不安的经济坏消息，这将坚定政府推动经济增长的决心。【原文：The start of Labour’s first full year in power has been marked by an avalanche of bad economic news that is unsettling both businesses and households, and will reinforce the government’s determination to push for growth.】

item.title: 由马克思主义游击队推动的可卡因暴力席卷哥伦比亚
item.description: 哥伦比亚东部的卡塔通博山区非常危险，警察和军队因为害怕狙击手，一般都不会离开军营太远。【原文：The mountains of Catatumbo in eastern Colombia are so dangerous that the police and army generally don’t stray far from their barracks for fear of snipers.】

item.title: 受特朗普影响的达沃斯希望看到更多行动
item.description: 大家好，欢迎来到达沃斯，世界经济论坛刚刚结束，与会官员分享了全球经济的不安前景。【原文：Hello and welcome to Davos, where the World Economic Forum has just ended with officials sharing an uneasy outlook for the global economy.】

item.title: 特朗普的天然气提议引发达沃斯众人深思
item.description:
行业领袖支持欧洲的气候议程，但有些人可能会被总统的廉价燃料承诺所动摇。【原文：

Industry leaders back Europe’s climate agenda, but some may be swayed by the president’s promise of cheap fuel.

】

item.title: Meta 和 TikTok 将在德国大选前接受欧盟压力测试
item.description: 欧盟计划在下个月德国大选之前，对社交媒体公司反击虚假信息的计划进行质询，这是欧盟首次对国家选举进行 "压力测试"。【原文：The European Union plans to grill social media companies on their plans to counter disinformation ahead of the German election next month in the bloc’s first “stress test” for a national election.】
